Class Drisk 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----Drisk
public class Drisk
extends Object
Drisk Class - Simulation of a computers hard disk ERRORS HANDLED: - Access to unallocated tracks ERRORS NOT HANDLED: - Index out of bounds

Version:
09.10.1998, 12.06.1998
Author:
Ken Schulz

freeTrack
track
TRACKS

Drisk()
Default Constructor initializes the drisk with 100 free tracks.

allocate()
allocate returns the track number of a newly allocated track returns -1 if none available
deallocate(int)
deallocate sends sepcfied track back into the abyss of reusable drisk space
getFreeTrack()
getFreeTrack returns the lowest available free track returns -1 if none available
getFreeTracks()
getFreeTracks return the number of tracks that are free on Drisk
isFree(int)
isFree returns true if the track is free
isFull()
isFull returns boolean true if drisk is full
readBlock(int)
readBlock returns the indicated block as an array of strings ERROR: If track is not allocated
readTrack(int)
readTrack returns the indicated track as an array of strings ERROR: If track is not allocated
writeBlock(int, String[])
writeBlock writes given information to a specific Block of data on the track NOTE: This method must take in a string array of 10 Elements!!! ERROR: If track is not allocated
writeTrack(int, String[])
writeTrack writes given information to a specific track NOTE: This method must take in a string array of 10 Elements!!! ERROR: If track is not allocated

track 
 protected String track[]
freeTrack 
 protected boolean freeTrack[]
TRACKS 
 protected static final int TRACKS

Drisk 
 public Drisk()
Default Constructor initializes the drisk with 100 free tracks. 1 Card = 10 Words 1 Track = 10 Words 1 Block = 10 Words 1 Drisk = 1000 Words = 100 Track Each word is a element in the tracks array

readTrack 
 public String[] readTrack(int trackNumber)
readTrack returns the indicated track as an array of strings ERROR: If track is not allocated

Parameters:
trackNumber - is the index of the track that will be returned
Returns:
An array of words which equals a track
writeTrack 
 public void writeTrack(int trackNumber,
                        String newTrack[])
writeTrack writes given information to a specific track NOTE: This method must take in a string array of 10 Elements!!! ERROR: If track is not allocated

Parameters:
trackNumber - is the index of the track that the data will be writen to
newTrack - is the new track that will be set at index trackNumber
Returns:
void
readBlock 
 public String[] readBlock(int blockNumber)
readBlock returns the indicated block as an array of strings ERROR: If track is not allocated

Parameters:
blockNumber - is the index of the track that will be returned
Returns:
An array of words which equals a block
writeBlock 
 public void writeBlock(int blockNumber,
                        String newBlock[])
writeBlock writes given information to a specific Block of data on the track NOTE: This method must take in a string array of 10 Elements!!! ERROR: If track is not allocated

Parameters:
blockNumber - is the index of the track that the data will be writen to
newBlock - is the new block of data that will be set at index blockNumber
Returns:
void
allocate 
 public int allocate()
allocate returns the track number of a newly allocated track returns -1 if none available

Returns:
int of allocated track
deallocate 
 public void deallocate(int freeTrackNumber)
deallocate sends sepcfied track back into the abyss of reusable drisk space

Parameters:
freeTrackNumber - is the track number that will be released to the wild
Returns:
void
getFreeTrack 
 public int getFreeTrack()
getFreeTrack returns the lowest available free track returns -1 if none available

Returns:
int of free track
isFree 
 public boolean isFree(int trackNumber)
isFree returns true if the track is free

Parameters:
trackNumber - is the track th
Returns:
boolean status oat will be checked if free
isFull 
 public boolean isFull()
isFull returns boolean true if drisk is full

Returns:
true if drisk is full
getFreeTracks 
 public int getFreeTracks()
getFreeTracks return the number of tracks that are free on Drisk

Returns:
number of free tracks
